result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.
.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription with random testing.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

CRT:  def started doing well then things started downhill - he still has been in communication w/ JSS - before I issue warrant, I'll ask Yang to go downstairs & talk to JSS & see when they last had contact w/ him - will recall case
CASE RECALLED - STATE by Lawrence / Def by Atty Yang
CASE RECALLED AGAIN - DEF NOW PRESENT
Def comments on why not present earlier
CRT:  none of that makes sense - you were set for SEH today & you didn't appear - big problems here - asks who in def's family is here:  sister, daughters
CRT:  I don't think he's paying attention to rules & I think he's using again - I know you have his meds - are you monitoring his meds
Sister:  I don't have his meds
CRT:  he told JSS you were holding his meds
Sister:  I don't have it...comments further
CRT:  addresses def - everyone is trying to make sure you don't go to prison but I can't get you to do what you need to do in community - I don't want to send you to prison but you're making it impossible not to do that
Def comments - can't get on methodone program for 2 weeks
CRT: comments...Not going to do SEH today - would like to see if there is some inpatient or other therapy or trmt def may be eligible for before I take him into custody.  With def's sister's permission - if you're willing to keep him - then I'm going to ask JSS to reduce def's freedom - def is on House Arrest & def is only able to leave residence to come to CRT - any other time has to be asked for by def's sister w/ JSS approval.  Def will be sent home w/ GPS & CRT is giving him 1 week - between now & next Mon if he has one violation, we're done.  Sister is to take control of def's medication.  Any violations of GPS & def will be taken into custody - CRT wants def tested by JSS today so we know what he has in him.  I know he will test positive - want to know what he has been using
CRT:  I'll reschedule the SEH after we see that he does this week
